foods.name: Chile Relleno
foods.description:
• A stuffed pepper dish from Puebla, Mexico, typically using poblano peppers

• Traditionally filled with cheese or picadillo (spiced meat) and coated in egg batter

foods.name: Conchas
foods.description:
• Traditional Mexican sweet bread named for its seashell-like appearance

• Features a sweet bread base with a crunchy topping in chocolate, vanilla, or strawberry flavors

foods.name: Chicharrones
foods.description:
• Crispy fried pork skin or belly, popular as a snack or taco filling

• Can be served with salsa verde or used in gorditas

foods.name: Mole (de pollo)
foods.description:
• Traditional Mexican sauce with many varieties including red, yellow, and green

• Complex sauce made with chilies, spices, and often chocolate or nuts

foods.name: Aguas Frescas
foods.description:
• Light non-alcoholic drinks made from fruits, cereals, or seeds

• Common varieties include tamarindo, jamaica, and horchata

foods.name: Pozole
foods.description:
• Traditional Mexican soup made with hominy and meat (chicken or pork)

• Typically garnished with lettuce/cabbage, chili peppers, onion, garlic, radishes, avocado, and lime

restaurants.name: Pancho's Antojitos Mexicano
restaurants.description: Pancho's Antojitos Mexicano is a cozy Mexican eatery in the heart of New York City, offering a variety of authentic dishes and flavors. With a focus on traditional recipes and fresh ingredients, Pancho's Antojitos Mex provides a casual dining experience for those looking to enjoy classic Mexican cuisine.
